title: International Villas goes into liquidation
text:
International Villas goes into liquidation 7 August 2015 Save 
International Villas is going into liquidation after the Spanish authorities tried to change its tax status. 
The company originally ceased trading last week and said work was under way to find a way of keeping it going. 
However, insolvency practitioner Gagen Sharma at Sharma & Co said the company is now going into liquidation and a creditors meeting has been called for August 25. 
She added: “The problem was the Spanish authorities. It was them who decided they wanted to make it a Spanish company rather than an English company. 
“They wanted to tax it as a Spanish company.” 
Sharma added the company, which was based in Saffron Walden, had minimal assets, adding: “They have a database, there are some people looking at it within the industry but we haven’t got any final offers.”
